adrFormatAddress: 5009 Broadway, New York, NY 10034, USA

originalText.text:
Incredible bar that really doesn’t appear so from outside. At first glance it seems unapproachable because of a dark awning stretching onto the sidewalk.

Once you get in there’s a swanky vibe with chesterfield couches and sofas and a well-stocked bar.

Daily weekday deals - makes drinks pretty cheap too.

Definitely check this place out! Cool spot for a large group hang too.

originalText.text: I came here with my friends to chill. Great drinks, popcorn, and mozzarella sticks. Great service. The bartenders were friendly. Inside is pretty loud because of the music playing. I like the interior, their lounge is nice and comfortable. There's also a TV screen for customers to watch. I do recommend this cozy spot. Great date.

text.text: I came here with my friends to chill. Great drinks, popcorn, and mozzarella sticks. Great service. The bartenders were friendly. Inside is pretty loud because of the music playing. I like the interior, their lounge is nice and comfortable. There's also a TV screen for customers to watch. I do recommend this cozy spot. Great date.

originalText.text: Favorite bar in the neighborhood! The vibe is so cozy and welcoming. Always delicious cocktails and bar snacks. They have 8 - midnight drink specials Monday through Thursday which we love!

text.text: Favorite bar in the neighborhood! The vibe is so cozy and welcoming. Always delicious cocktails and bar snacks. They have 8 - midnight drink specials Monday through Thursday which we love!

originalText.text:
My recent visit to Liffy II, a remarkable bar, was an absolute delight. One of their signature cocktails, crafted with mezcal, left a lasting impression with its remarkable kick and exquisite flavor. The blend of ingredients and craftsmanship resulted in a phenomenal cocktail that truly satisfied my taste buds. Moreover, the ambiance of Liffy II was nothing short of extraordinary, reminiscent of a sophisticated cigar lounge without the cigars. The spacious interior, adorned with huge red couches, exuded an inviting and comfortable atmosphere, making it an unforgettable experience.

The mezcal-based signature cocktail I had at Liffy II was a true standout. It possessed a remarkable kick that perfectly complemented the rich and smoky flavors of the mezcal. The bartenders' skillful craftsmanship was evident in the seamless blending of ingredients, resulting in a cocktail that was both well-balanced and exceptionally delicious. It was a true pleasure to savor such a phenomenal creation, and it left me wanting to explore more of Liffy II's cocktail offerings.

Beyond the remarkable cocktails, the ambiance of Liffy II added another layer of excellence to my visit. The bar's interior design evoked a sense of sophistication and elegance, akin to a classic cigar lounge. The choice of huge red couches added a touch of opulence while ensuring maximum comfort for patrons. The overall atmosphere was inviting and relaxed, creating an ideal setting for socializing or simply unwinding after a long day. Liffy II succeeded in creating a memorable and enjoyable environment that set the stage for a truly exceptional bar experience.

originalText.text:
I really wanted to love this place, the sofas/styling and the drinks are great, the bartender is also super nice. The anesthetics are exactly what I was looking for. Liffy II would be perfect as a low-key, intimate bar. The only issue is the music is extremely loud and makes you want to dance.

Normally that's not a problem, but there's no dance floor, and the bar layout is set up for quiet conversation and intimate get togethers, it's not a club. Liffy is setup like an intimate speakeasy with the soft seating and layout. If the music volume was half or a bit less than half, so you could actually talk to your group without screaming, this would probably be my favorite place in Inwood. There are plenty of loud, dance-focused clubs in the neighborhood, so it doesn't make sense that a cocktail lounge with beautiful sofas and wonderful anesthetics (including the bartenders classy outfit) would want to ruin that with the entirely wrong soundscape.

Hopefully they will lower the music volume, play a more chill and intimate Playlist, and lean into what would make them great and unique in the neighborhood. If they do that I will happily be a regular customer and that would make this a very easy 5 star review
